attributes.action: add recycling to UK schools to reduce pollution rates
attributes.additional_details: As a student of a secondary school, I see tons of plastic thrown out  and thousand of pieces of paper wasted per year. The average student at a secondary school produces 22kg of waste per pupil each academic year and the figure for primary schools is even higher at 45kg per pupil.
attributes.background: make recycling in schools mandatory to lower the pollution rates and to reduce waste of reusable materials. millions of students go to school everyday and waste thousands of recyclable opportunities.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for individual schools and local authorities, who are responsible for recycling provision in each area. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
